Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    cont_function, function, Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polynom_able
    This class represents a Polynom with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Shilo Gilor and Amiel Liberman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polynom()
      this is an empty constructor
      Polynom(Polynom polynom)
      this constructor is the copy constructor
      Polynom(java.lang.String string)
      This constructor gets a string and brakes it down to the coefficient and power and adds them as monoms

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Monom m1)
      the add monom function gets a given monom and adds it to the polynom of course if that monom already exists it just adds the coefficient to the given monom and if the sum of the coefficient is 0 so it removes it from the array
      void add(Polynom_able p1)
      The add polynom function gets a given polynom and the polynom we have and adds them together
      double area(double x0, double x1, double eps)
      the area function uses Riemann's Integral to calculate the area in this function we only calculate the area of the graph above the x line sumOfArea is the current sum of area being calculated
      Polynom_able copy()
      the copy function returns a polynom with the same monoms as it has temp_polynom is the temp polynom where we are adding all the monoms
      Polynom_able derivative()
      the derivative function takes this polynom and returns its derivative temp_polynom is the new polynom as the derivative
      boolean equals(Polynom_able p1)
      the equals function gets a given polynom and loops through its monoms and checks if the monoms are the same as in this polynom we iterate through both and check since both array have to be sorted already
      double f(double x)
      the function f calculates the value of the polynom given an x value value is the running value of the monoms
      boolean isZero()
      isZero function checks if all this polynom coefficient are zero of course a zero polynom has to be an empty array, but we are looping through just to double check
      java.util.Iterator<Monom> iteretor()
      the iterator functions returns a iterator of monoms
      void multiply(Polynom_able p1)
      the multiply polynom function gets a given polynom and multiplies it to the polynom temp_polynom is a temp polynom with the result of the multiple and then we change this monoms to point at the temp variable
      double root(double x0, double x1, double eps)
      The root function finds a root value of a polynom while given 2 values that 1 is positive and the other negative and eps which will make sure that we are eps close to the 0.
      void substract(Polynom_able p1)
      the substract polynom function gets a given polynom and substracts it to the polynom we use it by adding athe same monom but with a opposite value like that it subtracts
      java.lang.String toString()
      the toString function returns the monoms as a printable string

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        isZero function checks if all this polynom coefficient are zero of course a zero polynom has to be an empty array, but we are looping through just to double check
        Specified by:
        isZero in interface Polynom_able

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        The root function finds a root value of a polynom while given 2 values that 1 is positive and the other negative and eps which will make sure that we are eps close to the 0. xt is the current x value being checked value is the polynom value of xt
        Specified by:
        root in interface Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - should be the lower value of the x's provided
        x1 - should be the higher value of the x's provided
        eps - is the threshold value to check if the x value is close to the correct answer
        Returns:
        999999 when we are not sure if there is a result (hense x0*x1 is positive) or the x value that is close to the root

        public double area(double x0,

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        x1 - should be the higher value of the x's provided
